content: simple cable pattern for socks this is not a sock pattern it is a pattern for cabling socks materials yarn 350 400 yards of fingering weight yarn preferably a mostly solid colorway to make cables pop needles whatever size you normally use to knit socks misc stitch marker cable needle abbreviations c6b cable 6 back slip next 3 sts to cable needle and hold at back of work k3 from left needle then k3 from cable needle c6f cable 6 front slip next 3 sts to cable needle and hold at front of work k3 from left needle then k3 from cable needle 1 directions cast on 64 stitches 16 stitches on each of 4 needles place marker work 14 rounds of k2 p2 ribbing or however many rounds you prefer rounds 1 4 knit 6 purl 2 repeat all the way around round 5 cable round knit 6 purl 2 c6b purl next 2 stitches c6f purl next 2 stitches knit 6 purl 2 twice across front of sock c6b purl next 2 stitches c6f purl next 2 stitches knit 6 purl 2 repeat round 1 9 or 10 times i like to alternate the number of rounds between cable rounds repeat round 5 cable round continue in this manner until leg of sock is about 7 inches long or to your preferred length make sure to end with a cable round work heel on needles 1 and 4 the outer set of cables will end at heel the inner set of cables continues to the toe about 6 5 inches after heel is completed when you resume the cables make sure to purl the last 2 stitches on needle 1 on every round this will make the cables pop again make sure to end with a cable round work toe to complete sock copyright 2025 anne mancine 2
